title: Warren Gatland: 'Do-or-die descriptions are a bit sensitive at the moment...but my Wales team understand importance of France game'
text:
Wales have rejected Eddie Jones’ description of knockout matches as being ‘do-or-die,’ as they themselves prepare for a quarter-final against France on Sunday. Head coach Warren Gatland stressed the game's significance but refused to regard it in the same tone as the England head coach did, believing it offends local sensibilities.

“I wouldn’t be using do-or-die words,” said Gatland. “I think they’re a bit sensitive at the moment given what’s happened in the last few weeks. It’s just another game of rugby, but we know how important it is. We are very focused on wanting to get out there and stay in this tournament. There is a lot of confidence in this squad given we feel we have not given an...
description: Wales have rejected Eddie Jones’ description of knockout matches as being ‘do-or-die,’ as they themselves prepare for a quarter-final against France on Sunday.
